description: Hepatitis A is an infectious disease of the liver caused by Hepatovirus A (HAV). HAV is a species of virus in the order Picornavirales, humans and other vertebrates serve as natural hosts. The virus has only one serotype but multiple genotypes. HAV is resistant to detergent, acid, solvents (e.g., chloroform), and temperatures up to 60 °C. And HAV can be inactivated by chlorine treatment, formalin, peracetic acid, beta-propiolactone, and UV radiation.
name: Hepatitis A Virus (HAV) Antibodies and Antigens
